sun.jvm.hotspot.ui

Interface Editor


  • public interface Editor
    High-level interface describing what the debugger requires from an editor component in order to display source code. The EditorFactory is used to instantiate Editor objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearBreakpointAtLine(int lineNo)
      Clear a breakpoint indicator on the current (one-based) line.
      void clearBreakpoints()
      Clear all breakpoint indicators.
      int getCurrentLineNumber()
      Get (one-based) line number on which cursor is currently placed
      java.lang.String getSourceFileName()
      Get name of source file being displayed
      java.lang.Object getUserData()
      Get optional object of user data
      boolean hasBreakpointAtLine(int lineNo)
      Indicates whether a breakpoint indicator is visible on the current (one-based) line.
      void highlightLineNumber(int lineNo)
      Highlight a particular line number.
      void setUserData(java.lang.Object o)
      Set optional object of user data
      void showBreakpointAtLine(int lineNo)
      Show a breakpoint indicator on the current (one-based) line.
      void showLineNumber(int lineNo)
      Make a particular line number visible on the screen.
      void toFront()
      Bring the given Editor to the front of all other Editors.

        Get (one-based) line number on which cursor is currently placed

      • showLineNumber

        void showLineNumber(int lineNo)
        Make a particular line number visible on the screen. NOTE: line numbers are numbered starting from 1.

      • highlightLineNumber

        void highlightLineNumber(int lineNo)
        Highlight a particular line number. NOTE: line numbers are numbered starting from 1.

      • clearBreakpointAtLine

        void clearBreakpointAtLine(int lineNo)
        Clear a breakpoint indicator on the current (one-based) line.

      • clearBreakpoints

        void clearBreakpoints()
        Clear all breakpoint indicators.

      • setUserData

        Set optional object of user data

      • getUserData

        java.lang.Object getUserData()
        Get optional object of user data

      • toFront

        void toFront()
        Bring the given Editor to the front of all other Editors. This must also make this Editor the return value from EditorFactory.getCurrentEditor().
